keyMoments.title: Luffy Uses a Jutte Weapon
keyMoments.description: In a rare moment for the character, Detective Luffy wields a small jutte (traditional Japanese police weapon) while confronting Buggy to rescue Princess Vivi. He primarily holds it while punching, staying true to his fighting style.
keyMoments.significance: This is one of the only episodes in the entire One Piece anime where Luffy uses a weapon, making it an extremely unique and notable moment for the character.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Defeats Buggy and Rescues Vivi
keyMoments.description: Detective Luffy successfully defeats Buggy and his crew, rescuing Princess Vivi and protecting the Mochimaki Festival from Buggy's conspiracy.
keyMoments.significance: Continues Luffy's pattern of defeating Buggy throughout the series, even in this alternate universe filler setting.

alternateUniverseRole: Detective/Okappiki (Secret Policeman) in Grand Jipangu's Edo-period setting

reveals.information: Even in an alternate universe, Luffy maintains his role as protector and hero, defending others from villains

keyMoments.title: Zoro Catches and Discards the Prized Mochimaki
keyMoments.description: Zoro successfully catches the special mochimaki containing a diamond worth 10,000,000 rio berry during the festival. However, showing his characteristic disinterest in material wealth, he simply throws it away.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's core values remain consistent even in alternate universe settings - personal honor and strength matter more than treasure or money.

alternateUniverseRole: Hakaisou (Buddhist monk who broke his vows) in Grand Jipangu

reveals.information: Zoro's disinterest in material wealth is a core character trait that transcends even alternate universe settings

keyMoments.title: Rice Cake Delivery Preparation
keyMoments.description: As Onami, a restaurant owner in this alternate universe, Nami works with Sanji and Chopper to prepare and deliver rice cakes for the Mochimaki Festival.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Nami in a business owner role, which aligns with her entrepreneurial spirit and leadership qualities from the main series.

alternateUniverseRole: Onami, owner of The Pinwheel restaurant in Grand Jipangu

keyMoments.title: Buggy's Conspiracy Unfolds
keyMoments.description: Buggy devises multiple schemes to steal the valuable mochimaki containing a 10,000,000 rio berry diamond during the festival.
keyMoments.significance: Continues Buggy's recurring role as an antagonist, showing his greedy nature transcends even alternate universe settings.

keyMoments.title: Buggy Takes Princess Vivi Hostage
keyMoments.description: After his theft attempts fail, Buggy escalates by taking Princess Vivi hostage to obtain the valuable mochimaki.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Buggy's willingness to use underhanded tactics and harm innocents for personal gain, consistent with his character throughout the series.

keyMoments.title: Buggy is Defeated by Luffy
keyMoments.description: Detective Luffy defeats Buggy, foiling his conspiracy and rescuing Princess Vivi.
keyMoments.significance: Continues the series-long pattern of Luffy defeating Buggy in their confrontations.

alternateUniverseRole: Antagonist and schemer in Grand Jipangu

keyMoments.title: Vivi Taken Hostage
keyMoments.description: Princess Vivi, the shogun's daughter in this alternate universe, is taken hostage by Buggy as part of his scheme to steal the valuable mochimaki.
keyMoments.significance: Places Vivi in a damsel-in-distress role, contrasting with her more active role in the main storyline.

keyMoments.title: Vivi Rescued by Luffy
keyMoments.description: Detective Luffy rescues Princess Vivi from Buggy's clutches, ensuring her safety and the success of the festival.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces Luffy's protective relationship with Vivi, which was established during the Alabasta arc.

alternateUniverseRole: Princess and daughter of the shogun in Grand Jipangu
